ihs.apcs.spacebattle.commands

Class WarpCommand

  • java.lang.Object
    • ihs.apcs.spacebattle.commands.ShipCommand
      • ihs.apcs.spacebattle.commands.WarpCommand

  • public class WarpCommand
extends ShipCommand
    A command to warp a ship. Warping moves a ship a great distance in a short period of time. Warping can be done in one of two ways:
    • A "random warp" that warps a ship a random distance in a random direction
    • A "directed warp" that warps a ship a given distance in the direction it is currently facing
    Warping is delayed by 1 second (while the warp drive warms up) and requires a cool-down period after the warp is completed. The cool-down period and energy cost of a warp vary based on the type and distance.
    Since:
    0.9

    • Constructor Detail

      • WarpCommand

        public WarpCommand()
        Creates a random warp command.

        The ship will be warped a random distance up to 1000 pixels both horizontally and vertically. A random warp has a cool-down period of 5 seconds.

      • WarpCommand

        public WarpCommand(double distance)
        Creates a directed warp command.

        The ship will be warped the given distance (maximum of 400 pixels) in the direction the ship is currently facing. A directed warp has a cool-down period of distance / 50.

        Parameters:
        distance - the distance to warp (maximum 400)

        public static int getInitialEnergyCost()
        Gets the one-time energy cost to initiate this command.
        Returns:

      • getOngoingEnergyCost

        public static int getOngoingEnergyCost()
        Gets the energy cost per second of this command.
        Returns:
        the amount of energy consumed per second while this command is executing (9)
